item.author: Jerry Capital

item.content:encoded: Redfin got acquired today. Shout out their CEO for the one of the wildest things I've ever heard on an earnings call - Analyst: What if mortgage rates don't come down? - Glenn: We'll drink our own urine or our competitors blood. Stay in the foxhole.
item.author: BuccoCapital Bloke

item.content:encoded: He used the T word *DELTA CEO SEES IMPACT ON TRAVEL DEMAND AS `TRANSITORY'
item.author: Hiroo Onoda

item.content:encoded: In my years as a civil rights lawyer, I’ve never seen a more clear cut First Amendment violation, or a more flagrant government declaration of intent to violate blackletter law. Part of the point here is to dare the courts to uphold longstanding precedent.
item.author: Alec Karakatsanis

item.content:encoded: BREAKING: French satellite company Eutelsat is replacing Starlink and plans to send approximately 40,000 communication terminals to Ukraine. Their stock has rocketed 390% in the last 3 days as @Tesla @Starlink @SpaceX and @X continue their freefall. LMFAO GET FUCKED @elonmusk

item.content:encoded: Look, so I don’t want to do that thing where I say Trump is crashing the economy on purpose, because I’m not. But I was watching his interview on Sunday and reading his Truth Social posts and I mean, you look at the comments, about not ruling out a recession and his obsession

item.content:encoded: I had to confirm for myself that this is actually an official White House statement. It is.
item.author: Seth Abramson

item.content:encoded: From Paul Graham on YC founding 20 years ago: the same lesson may very well to science policy! Smaller grants, quicker, to 'hacker types with good ideas', including young people. Many "science of science" folks studying these mechanisms, but broadly, we haven't even tried them.
item.author: Kevin A. Bryan

item.content:encoded: If you change the framework from 'no growth' to 'favorable supply side dynamics,' this famous Peter Lynch quote makes all the more sense.
item.author: Lawrence Hamtil

item.content:encoded: Delta significantly lowers its Q1 guidance on soft domestic demand: "The outlook has been impacted by the recent reduction in consumer and corporate confidence caused by increased macro uncertainty, driving softness in Domestic demand" $DAL: -14% AH
item.author: The Transcript

item.content:encoded: In a world of Matts, be a Derek.
item.author: Seth Abramson

item.content:encoded: As $DAL and other travel/consumer names warn of softness, I would be remiss not to point out that $LYV, which has stopped growing, earned less than $1 in the LTM, fully-taxed. And that’s with charging you all those additional ticketing fees, lol. With the stock at $123.
item.author: James Chanos

item.content:encoded: $DHR: good discussion on how Cepheid went from 4th player pre-pandemic to the largest one post-pandemic in molecular diagnostics, and why there is likely to be more consolidation.

item.content:encoded: I honestly never understood this. Obviously if f'(x) is some function of x you can just follow the path along computationally and you find a function which satisfies the DE. does this need proof?

item.content:encoded: Judge Furman of the Southern District of New York has ordered that detained Columbia University protest organizer Mahmoud Khalil not be deported and that all parties meet in court on Wednesday in response to Khalil's habeas petition, filed yesterday:
